currency_change_warning:
Changing the base currency will switch the currency unit of all bills and affect the automatic exchange rate conversion when creating new bills.

Example: If the previous functional currency was RMB, and you recorded a ¥100 expense, when the functional currency is switched to USD, the original bill will change to $100.

If you have previously recorded bills in a non-functional currency, the value converted to the functional currency will prevail.

Example: If the previous functional currency was RMB, and you recorded a $100 USD expense (assuming the converted value at that time was ¥700), when the functional currency is switched to USD, the original bill will change to $700.
ledger-will-keep-original-category: Ledger will keep its original category

ledger-type-will-be-updated-to: All ledger type will be converted to {n}
ledger-tags-will-be-changed: Ledger tags will be updated to selected tags
bill-compression-tip: When you frequently modify or delete bill data in batches, the incremental data saved in the cloud may become extremely large. [Bill Compression] can be used to reduce the size of this cloud data. Please ensure that the bill data on all devices has been completely uploaded before proceeding with the operation; after compressing the bills, it is best practice for other devices to log in again to ensure they retrieve the latest data.
wait-synced-tip: Please wait cloud sync to be finished

preset_question.analyze_ledger.label: Analyze current ledger
preset_question.monthly_budget.label: Help me create a monthly budget
preset_question.monthly_budget.prompt: Based on my spending this month and in the past, create a monthly budget that fits my habits to help reduce unnecessary expenses.
preset_question.anomaly_detection.label: Check for bill anomalies
preset_question.anomaly_detection.prompt: Are there any anomalies in my current bills?
preset_question.annual_summary.label: Annual Summary
preset_question.annual_summary.prompt:
Please generate an [Annual Ledger Summary] for me.

This is a comprehensive annual analysis task. Please follow these requirements:

1. Time range: Cover a complete calendar year (start and end dates should be based on the year corresponding to the current data, or as specified by the system/context, if not specified, and the current year is not over, the previous year is used).
2. This is a [Macro Statistics + Multi-dimensional Analysis] task. You can and should call the analyze_bills tool multiple times to complete statistics from different dimensions.
3. Please include at least the following analysis dimensions (you can extend as needed):
   - Annual total income, total expenses, and balance
   - Expense composition by [Category] (Top categories)
   - Expense trends by [Month] (identify volatile or anomalous months)
   - Average daily expenses & Maximum single-day expenses
   - Most frequent expense categories or tags (spending habits)
   - Whether there are obvious phase changes (e.g., beginning of year vs. end of year)
4. During the analysis process:
   - All conclusions must be based on real data obtained through tools
   - No subjective speculation is allowed
5. When outputting the final result, please:
   - Summarize in a natural, "annual review" narrative style
   - Provide 2-4 "data-based personal insights"
   - Provide 1-3 "improvement or recommendation directions for the next year"

Please begin your analysis.
